comment: In this position Black can exert no pressure on White's centre; his pieces - especially the Rook and Knight on the Rook files - are very poorly placed. To justify the position of Rh5, Black will have to attempt a direct attack on White's King, but this is problematic as White's central dominance allows him to maneuver his pieces rapidly, whether for attack or defence of any threatened sector.
reasoning: The comment identifies a strategic flaw in Black's planning, suggesting a weak center and a lack of effective piece placement, indicating a mistake.
